creditline: The William Hood Dunwoody Fund and the Putnam Dana McMillan Fund
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Cup-shaped with an open bottom section with 4 stiff panels stretched between base and ring at bottom of foot; woven with zigzag pattern with dark band at center
markings: [FX971342], on dealer\'s tag, attached to bottom
text: The Central African Lunda people currently live on both sides of the border between the south of the Democratic Republic of Congo and northwestern Angola. Their empire, which flourished between the seventeenth and nineteenth centuries, in the past dominated a much larger area, and as a result their material culture shows many signs of extensive borrowing from neighboring populations.
title: Basket
